intro: Tetramerium leptocaule, commonly known as the slender-stemmed tetramerium, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are small berries that contain several seeds. Tetramerium leptocaule is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in woodland and forest understory habitats.
